contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=July 2011}} [[Image:WulfeniteUSGOV.jpg|thumb|right|200px|An example of the tetragonal crystals, [[wulfenite]]]] In [[crystallography]], the '''tetragonal''' [[crystal system]] is one of the 7 lattice [[point group]]s. Tetragonal [[crystal lattice]]s result from stretching a cubic lattice along one of its lattice vectors, so that the [[Cube (geometry)|cube]] becomes a rectangular [[Prism (geometry)|prism]] with a square base (''a'' by ''a'') and height (''c'', which is different from ''a''). There are two tetragonal [[Bravais lattice]]s: the simple tetragonal (from stretching the simple-cubic lattice) and the centered tetragonal (from stretching either the face-centered or the body-centered cubic lattice). One might suppose stretching face-centered cubic would result in face-centered tetragonal, but face-centered tetragonal is equivalent to body-centered tetragonal, BCT (with a smaller lattice spacing). BCT is considered more fundamental, so that is the standard terminology.<ref>{{Cubic-to-Tetragonal Transition|url=http://www.aem.umn.edu/people/faculty/shield/hane/tet.html}}</ref> {| class=wikitable |+ Tetragonal Bravais lattices !Primitive !Body-centered |- |[[image:Tetragonal.svg|100px]] |[[image:Tetragonal-body-centered.svg|100px]] |} The [[crystallographic point group|point groups]] that fall under this crystal system are listed below, followed by their representations in international notation and [[Schoenflies notation]], and [[mineral]] examples.<ref>http://webmineral.com/crystal/Tetragonal.shtml Webmineral</ref><ref>Hurlbut, Cornelius S.; Klein, Cornelis, 1985, ''Manual of Mineralogy'', 20th ed., pp. 73 - 78, ISBN 0-471-80580-7 </ref> {| class="wikitable" !rowspan=2 width=60|# !colspan=5|Point group !rowspan=2|Example !rowspan=2|[[Space group]]s |- !Class ![[Hermann-Mauguin_notation|Intl]] ![[Schoenflies notation|Schoenflies]] ![[Orbifold]] ![[Coxeter notation|Coxeter]] |- !75-80 |Tetragonal pyramidal |4||''C<sub>4</sub>''||44||[4]<sup>+</sup> |[[pinnoite]], [[richellite]] | P4, P4<sub>1</sub>, P4<sub>2</sub>, P4<sub>3</sub>, I4, I4<sub>1</sub> |- !81-82 |Tetragonal disphenoidal |{{overline|4}}||''S<sub>4</sub>''||2x||[2<sup>+</sup>,4<sup>+</sup>] |[[cahnite]], [[tugtupite]] | P{{overline|4}}, I{{overline|4}} |- !83-88 |Tetragonal dipyramidal |4/m||''C<sub>4h</sub>''||4*||[2,4<sup>+</sup>] |[[scheelite]], [[wulfenite]], [[leucite]] | P4/m, P4<sub>2</sub>/m, P4/n, P4<sub>2</sub>/n, I4/m, I4<sub>1</sub>/a |- !89-98 |Tetragonal trapezohedral |422||''D<sub>4</sub>''||224||[2,4]<sup>+</sup> |[[cristobalite]], [[wardite]] | P422, P42<sub>1</sub>2, P4<sub>1</sub>22, P4<sub>1</sub>2<sub>1</sub>2, P4<sub>2</sub>22, P4<sub>2</sub>2<sub>1</sub>2, P4<sub>3</sub>22, P4<sub>3</sub>2<sub>1</sub>2, I422, I4<sub>1</sub>22 |- !99-110 |Ditetragonal pyramidal |4mm|| ''C<sub>4v</sub>''||*44||[4] |[[diaboleite]] | P4mm, P4bm, P4<sub>2</sub>cm, P4<sub>2</sub>nm, P4cc, P4nc, P4<sub>2</sub>mc, P4<sub>2</sub>bc, I4mm, I4cm, I4<sub>1</sub>md, I4<sub>1</sub>cd |- !111-122 |Tetragonal scalenohedral |{{overline|4}}2m||''D<sub>2d</sub>''||2*2||[2<sup>+</sup>,4] |[[chalcopyrite]], [[stannite]] | P{{overline|4}}2m, P{{overline|4}}2c, P{{overline|4}}2<sub>1</sub>m, P{{overline|4}}2<sub>1</sub>c, P{{overline|4}}m2, P{{overline|4}}c2, P{{overline|4}}b2, P{{overline|4}}n2, I{{overline|4}}m2, I{{overline|4}}c2, I{{overline|4}}2m, I{{overline|4}}2d |- !123-142 |Ditetragonal dipyramidal |4/mmm||''D<sub>4h</sub>''||*224||[2,4] |[[rutile]], [[pyrolusite]], [[zircon]] | P4/mmm, P4/mcc, P4/nbm, P4/nnc, P4/mbm, P4/mnc, P4/nmm, P4/ncc, P4<sub>2</sub>/mmc, P4<sub>2</sub>/mcm, P4<sub>2</sub>/nbc, P4<sub>2</sub>/nnm, P4<sub>2</sub>/mbc, P4<sub>2</sub>/mnm, P4<sub>2</sub>/nmc, P4<sub>2</sub>/ncm, I4/mmm, I4/mcm, I4<sub>1</sub>/amd, I4<sub>1</sub>/acd |}
